ygData.subject: Re: Simply Charming...
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Yeah, it won t work with a player if you do just one charm - the mob will turn on the player doing the damage eventually. It *will* work with multiple
ygData.messageBody:
On Mon, 13 Dec 1999, James Schuldes wrote:
>
> I train Merv onto poor old Guard Fred. Well, old Fred starts whacking on
> Merv but Merv don't care about some lame greenie whacking at him and keeps
> chasing me. So, I just keep on kiting and eventually Fred nibbles him down
> and KS's him off me.
>
> So now I am thinking, hmmm, I bet I could do this with a party member and we
> would get he kill and the xp??? Might have to try it sometime. I think that
> Merv might view things a little differently if a party member is slashing
> his tail feathers or not?

Yeah, it won't work with a player if you do just one charm -
the mob will turn on the player doing the damage eventually.
It *will* work with multiple charms. There's a 2-person
"kiting" method that works similarly. One person with SoW
nukes/taunts a mob to get it mad at him and runs in circles.
The other person stands in the middle and blasts at it.

> Or charm Fred when he has Merv down to low health
> - I guess that would have worked too. I was in a risk adverse mood right
> then.

I've wondered what'll happen then too. I've never tried it
because I'm afraid of Merv instantly whacking the guard
because I'm no longer a valid target and the guard is on his
hate list, and I'll take the faction hit. Tells us what
happens if you do try it. :-)

--
